title: Senior Applied Scientist, FinTech Accounting Intelligence Services
description:
\- 3\+ years of building machine learning models for business application experience
\- PhD, or Master's degree and 6\+ years of applied research experience
\- Experience programming in Java, C\+\+, Python or related language
\- Experience with neural deep learning methods and machine learning
  

The Finance Technology (FinTech) Accounting Intelligence Services (“AIS”) team is building the future of Amazon’s internal accounting and finance applications using AI \& ML to ensure complete, timely and accurate financial data while enabling timely decisions through data driven insights. We build AI/ML systems that use Amazon’s vast landscape of transactional data and knowledge bases with the latest techniques for financial forecasting, classification, anomaly detection, document processing and end user natural language Q\&A purposes. We are seeking a Senior Applied Scientist to spearhead the development of Generative AI applications that will redefine the financial services industry. You will harness the transformative power of Large Language Models (LLMs) and multi\-agent architectures to drive disruptive innovation.
You will collaborate closely with cross\-functional business and engineering teams to identify and deliver high\-impact use cases for Generative AI. You will design, develop, and evaluate Generative AI models and agents. You will partner with engineering teams to ensure seamless model deployment and integration into production systems, while also driving continued scientific innovation as a published thought leader and practitioner.
You will mentor and develop junior scientists and engineers, fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement. You will contribute to the broader research community by publishing your work in peer\-reviewed conferences and journals.
The ideal candidate thrives in ambiguity, builds collaborative relationships, moves fast, and is passionate about the customer experience. They lead by example, can communicate effectively with a wide variety of audiences and are comfortable pitching new ideas. If you love finding innovative solutions to complex and ambiguous problems while working hard, having fun, and making history, this may be the opportunity for you.
  

* Experience with modeling tools such as R, scikit\-learn, Spark MLLib, MxNet, Tensorflow, numpy, scipy etc.
* Track record of publications in top\-tier machine learning conferences or journals

title: Principal Product Manager, Amazon Shipping
description:
\- 10\+ years of product or program management, product marketing, business development or technology experience
\- 10\+ years of blending product and program management skills to execute strategic initiatives about process creation, standardization, and improvement experience
\- Bachelor's degree
\- Experience owning/driving roadmap strategy and definition
\- Experience with end to end product delivery
\- Experience with feature delivery and tradeoffs of a product
\- Experience as a product manager or owner
  

Join Amazon Shipping team to shape the future of shipping as a part of a new, emerging business and solve the biggest customer pain points in the small parcel logistics industry globally.
It’s no secret that Amazon relies on its technology to deliver millions of packages every day to its customers – on time, with low cost. We, the Product and Technology organization, simplify complex software solutions that work across our shippers, vendors, and warehouses to optimize both time \& cost of getting the packages delivered. Our services already handle thousands of requests per second, make business decisions impacting billions of dollars a year, integrate with a network of small and large shippers, operators and drivers worldwide, manage business rules for millions of unique products, and improve the ordering and delivery experience for millions of online shoppers. That said, this remains a fast\-growing business and our technical journey has only started. Our mission is to build the most efficient and optimal shipping solution on the planet, using our technology and engineering muscle as our biggest advantage. We aim to leverage top technologies in big data and optimization techniques to operate high volume, low latency, and high availability services.
What will you do?
As a Principal Product Manager, you will lead new, large product initiatives to define the long\-term strategy and vision to meet emerging customer needs. You will handle complex product development and business management scenarios, proactively identifying gaps/opportunities to then develop a suite of products to solve the problems.
The ideal candidate has a strong logistics/supply chain and product management background combined with a solid understanding of current technologies. S/he can develop and drive high\-level strategic initiatives but also roll up their sleeves, dig in and get the job done. Maturity, strong business judgment, ability to influence cross\-functional and remote teams, a customer\-centric and creative mindset with strong analytical skills are essential. This opportunity requires excellent product management, prioritization, and communication skills, as well as the ability to navigate ambiguity.
Key job responsibilities
• Define a data\-driven product vision, detailed requirements, and prioritize competing opportunities.
• Work directly with stakeholders and engineering to build exceptional products.
• Partner with other teams across Amazon Shipping Product and Tech to identify and influence development of new products and services.
• Understand customer (external and internal) needs, define clear project plans and execute to high expectations in a fast\-paced environment.
• Interact with stakeholders at multiple levels and in multiple locations, working with business, operations, tech and BI teams to define and deliver solutions.
• Anticipate bottlenecks, provide escalation management, and make tradeoffs to balance business needs versus technical or operational constraints.
• Collaborate with global stakeholders in other regions to define requirements that support international use cases.
• Define user stories and product requirements; while contributing to the technical design of new product features.
• About 10% travel required.
  

* Experience owning technology products

title: Sr. UX Designer, People Engagement Experience (PEX)
description:
\- 6\+ years of UX designer or interaction designer experience
\- Have an available online portfolio
  

The People Engagement Experience (PEX) is the thread across our People Engagement (PE) experiences made up of forward\-thinking UX designers, researchers, writers and design technologists. PEX is revolutionizing the user experience for Amazonians across the globe. Our design work has a direct impact on the lives of millions of Amazonians, helping them achieve work\-life balance and advance in their careers. We’re also customer\-obsessed, driving impact across the company by delivering on user\-centered and business needs. We support Amazon's mission to become Earth's best employer through making it easier to acquire, train and retain employees.
As a UX Designer of the PEX team, you will be responsible for the design of the end\-to\-end employee experience. You’ll craft elegant design solutions across a range of personas and platforms at global scale and collaborate closely with product and engineering partners, as well as multiple partner teams within the broader People Experience Technology (PXT) and Amazon Worldwide Operation orgs. As a senior designer, you’ll own experiences in the Amazon employee mobile app, AtoZ, and features supporting our end\-to\-end employee lifecycle within the app. You will also identify large scope product and long\-term design vision to raise the UX bar for this domain.
To succeed in this role, the candidate must be an innovative self\-starter in driving operational excellence and a strategic big\-picture thinker. The candidate must have proven the ability to succeed in a highly ambiguous, fast\-paced environment. Our environment requires the skills to work collaboratively and the commitment to take ownership when needed.
Key job responsibilities
\- Assume ownership for the end to end product experiences and features across desktop, mobile and more. 
\- Manage the user experience design of multiple mid\-to\-large\-sized programs.
\- Contribute to the vision for the organization and influence product strategic roadmap. Lead the discovery, strategize concept design and launch phases of a project.
\- Champion user\-centered design culture. Drive creative process and collaboration with cross\-functional partners to propose new ideas and strategies.
\- Model behavior that exemplifies Amazon Leadership Principles in their team. Raises the design bar for the organization.
\- Provide coaching and feedback, with an emphasis on growing junior Independent Contributors and leadership capability.
\- Create and drive adoption of design guidelines, mechanisms, best practices, process and tools.
A day in the life
The Senior UX Designer will be working with product and engineering stakeholders closely on day\-to\-day basis. While this designer independently owns multiple products/features at the same time, he/she will also collaborate with other UX designers in the same team on connecting individual features to a holistic experience. UX Researcher and UX Content will support you in your work. This designer will share design work regularly with design team peer review, stakeholder review and leadership.
About the team
We are a multidisciplinary team creating truly meaningful products and experiences that empower and connect millions of Amazon employees. Our team consist of designers, researchers and writers, and is very diverse in terms of educational background, race, skills, and location.
  

* Experience defining and maintaining design patterns and UX standards
* Experience with UX design of complex workflows
* Experience working with stakeholders to plan and execute programs that are strategic in nature
* Experience in delivering design solutions for projects of large scope and complexity
* Experience acquiring user data (e.g., conducting usability studies, performing user research) and creating personas and journey maps
* Excellent communication, presentation, and storytelling skills with an ability to present to and influence other designers, PMs, and senior executive management.

title: Software Development Engineer, Suspicious Activity Monitoring
description:
\- 3\+ years of non\-internship professional software development experience
\- Experience programming with at least one software programming language
\- 2\+ years of non\-internship design or architecture (design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and existing systems experience
  

You have super powers. Use them for good. We catch bad guys and stop online fraud. It’s fun. It’s hard. It matters. We need you.
Amazon’s Financial Fraud team is engaged in a technological arms race: cyber\-criminals from across the world continually look for new ways to steal from us and cover their tracks, while we invent new techniques to detect and neutralize them with ever increasing speed and scale.
It’s fun. We don’t just catch the bad guys; we stop crimes before they happen. Remember the "Minority Report"? It’s just like that. Basically, we predict the future by developing and applying cutting\-edge machine learning systems to detect, predict, and prevent online fraud before it happens.
It’s hard. This is Amazon, so of course our services are low latency, high throughput, highly scalable, and failure proof. Our fraud prevention systems are also highly reactive: we process multiple terabytes of data yet notice changes in individual behavior patterns in seconds. Even by Amazon standards, our datasets are massive and our transaction rates impressive, and everything is built with a scrupulous attention to security.
It matters. Amazon is one of the world’s most trusted companies. Consider the implications of losing that trust. Third\-party sellers account for nearly half the items purchased on Amazon. This nearly always goes smoothly; but when sellers cheat buyers, everyone loses. Even after we refund their money, buyers are less likely to shop at Amazon in the future. Legitimate sellers lose potential sales and are less likely to sell on Amazon. And of course, the money Amazon pays in refunds and chargebacks goes straight to our bottom line and ultimately results in higher prices for all our customers.
We are looking for a passionate and innovative Software Development Engineer to join a brand new small, agile team of engineers who love solving hard problems focused on detecting and stopping bad actors.
Amazon is one of the world’s most trusted companies. Help us keep it that way.
About the team
Here at Selling Partner Services, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have 14 employee\-led affinity groups, reaching 10,000\+ employees in chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our DEI Ambassador Program. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.
  

* Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent
* 3\+ years of full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations experience

Its mission is to deliver fast, reliable internet to customers and communities around the world, and we’ve designed the system with the capacity, flexibility, and performance to serve a wide range of customers, from individual households to schools, hospitals, businesses, government agencies, and other organizations operating in locations without reliable connectivity.

As a SAP Business Process Solution Architect you are responsible for process designing, implementing, and supporting SAP solutions for supply chain and manufacturing solutions. description:

As part of consumables business, we strive to make Amazon one stop shop for all the daily needs of a customer by making customer journey effortless. Our mission as category tech team is to create innovative solutions to meet specialized needs of everyday essentials categories to delight our customers \& Selling partners. We simplify product discovery, personalize purchase experiences, enable complaint access to Regulated products selection, optimize category operations and enhance vendor tooling across all EE categories. As part of this team, we would be working closely for customers across Pets, Beauty, baby, household goods, health and other every day essentials categories. Right now team is working on a confidential project to unlock a new selection to Amazon business (a rare and unique opportunity). There are challenges across all aspects of customer journey dealing with a regulated product as they need to abide by special regulations.
We are the category Tech Team \- a group of engineers, product managers and designers focused on helping customers discover and purchase the right products. Our customers care for their needs, and Amazon cares too. The business is growing fast, and most important the team is building features that impact hundreds of millions of customers!
THE CHALLENGES WE WILL TACKLE
As with every project within Amazon, we work backwards from our customer's needs, address the problems they meet and innovate on new technologies. Our team will tackle problems such as: 
\- Unlocking a new category of selection at amazon for customers to purchase.
\- Simplify the process of choosing the right product. 
\- Automate all recurring purchases. 
\- Personalize customers' search and shopping experiences to help them find useful products. These preferences will be automatically inferred or directly declared by our customers.

2\) Own, build and automate generation of business metrics using Tableau and Excel.
3\) Understand high\-level business goals and continually align work with them to meet needs of business.
4\) Examine and solve problems at their root, stepping back to understand the broader context.
Recognize and adopt best practices in data investigation and reporting: data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and self\-service automation.
5\) Write high quality code to retrieve and review data. Learn and understand a broad range of Amazon's data resources.
About the team
OUR CULTURE AND YOU
We are a tightly knit group that share our experiences and help each other succeed. We love hard problems and like to move fast in a growing team and changing environment. We use data to guide our decisions and we always push the technology and process boundaries of what is feasible on behalf of our customers. The most successful members of our team are obsessed with helping our customers in creative ways, bring clarity to ambiguity through data driven experimentation and have bias for action. If that sounds like an environment you like, join us.

title: Principal Product Manager - Tech, Transactional Services
description:
\- 7\+ years of working as a Technical Product Manager experience
\- 5\+ years of technical (software development, network development, IT, other related) experience
  

Are you interested in helping AWS deliver ever\-stronger durability, availability and disaster recovery, performance, scalability, and cost effectiveness for our customers? Are you excited by the prospect of partnering with a vast array of AWS service teams, identifying opportunities to improve their products on these dimensions, and leading technical product definition and execution to deliver on these opportunities? Would you enjoy working with a technically deep, senior engineering team on distributed systems innovation in areas such as consensus protocols and storage? If so, this might be the role for you.
Journal is a foundational AWS service that vends and manages commit logs for a number of AWS services – from databases to storage systems to compute services and beyond. These services typically use Journal on the critical path: every write or resource creation is first written to a Journal commit log. To support this, Journal is purpose\-built to provide high durability (10\+ 9s), high availability (99\.999%), high scale (100MM writes per second and growing), low latency (microseconds matter), and cost effectiveness (cents per TiB matter).
While Journal plays a significant role across AWS today, we need to define and deliver the right forward\-looking product improvements so we can keep raising the bar in what we as AWS offer to our customers. We are looking for the right Product Management leader to helm this effort, leading Journal’s customer engagement, product strategy, feature definition, and roadmap. The successful candidate will have a track record of formulating technical product direction and delivering on it, from guiding star vision to 3\-year\-plan to detail at the API and SLA level. They will have the technical aptitude required to partner effectively with senior technologists. They will have experience driving success across a diversity of customers, including building relationships, identifying needs, and partnering on engagements.
If this sounds up your alley, we’d love to hear from you.
Key job responsibilities
The primary responsibility of the Principal Product Manager \- Technical (Principal PMT\-ES) role is to own and drive the Transactional Services area forward. You will achieve this by owning the product vision, creating the product strategy, defining the customer experience, and identifying business opportunities. You own the product lifecycle including the product roadmap and feature prioritization. You are expected to contribute to engineering discussions that dive deeply into how a product solution or experience is designed and constructed. As the product manager in a deeply technical area, are expected to have deep full\-stack technical knowledge and apply this knowledge to make sure service quality, performance, and elasticity of the service will scale with the customer. You also work backwards from customers and collaborate with stakeholders to achieve the best outcomes for customer experience, adoption, and operational excellence while managing and optimizing for cost. You will provide clarity where there is ambiguity. You are a builder and, most importantly, you are customer\-obsessed.
Come build with us.
If you are interested, reach out to the hiring manager
https://www.linkedin.com/in/panghalvikas/
A day in the life
Given the scope and high level of ownership that a product manager has on the Transactional Services team, rarely are two days the same. You are a business owner, customer\-facing representative for the service, and point of contact for partner teams. On a weekly basis, you will be working with customers to learn about the problems they are trying to solve, analyzing service and business metrics, writing PRFAQs and pricing narratives, iterating on product decisions with the engineering team, thinking big to envision what's next, and demonstrating curiosity about different technologies, growth strategies, and industry trends.
On a daily basis, you will have a chance to work with everyone who makes products at AWS successful, including senior leadership, engineers, data scientists, content writers, and more. You will meet with customers to understand our core strengths and weaknesses. You will synthesize that feedback and other industry knowledge, with business and service data, to create strategies and test hypotheses. As someone central to the success of Transactional Services, people will look to you on a regular basis to solve problems and connect them with specialists. To develop that expertise, you will constantly be looking to learn by reaching out to other experts within the company and in the larger tech community, using your own product by developing samples, demos, and side\-projects, and engaging in mentorship opportunities. Our customers are developers and technical decision makers, so you will be using code, technical documentation, and architecture diagrams to understand problems and communicate solutions.
  

* Experience delivering large\-scale SaaS, PaaS or LaaS products where you are responsible for the full product lifecycle, from concept through GTM (go to market)

title: Finance Manager FP&A and Automation, Amazon Supply Chain Services (ASCS)
description:
\- 5\+ years of tax, finance or a related analytical field experience
\- BA or BS in Finance, Accounting, Business, Economics, or a highly analytical field (e.g., Engineering, Math, Computer Science) and 5\+ years of finance experience, or Master’s degree and 3\+ years of finance experience
  

Amazon Supply Chain Services (ASCS) is the umbrella name for Amazon’s suite of services that help businesses transport, warehouse, fulfill, deliver, and plan their movement of goods, inclusive of both on\- and off\-Amazon volume. With ASCS, businesses can offload their full supply chain planning \& execution or they can choose to integrate an à la carte menu of composable supply chain primitives into their existing processes. For many years, these services have been used by Amazon sellers as standalone solutions and have played a central role in improving the Amazon CX and reducing our CTS. In 2024, we began accelerating both the externalization of these services, so that merchants can use them for their off\-Amazon channels, as well as the interoperability of these services, which enables merchants to easily use more than one service at a time. Our three largest ASCS services that service off\-Amazon volume are Multi\-Channel Fulfillment (using inventory in Amazon’s fulfillment network to ship orders from non\-Amazon channels), Amazon Freight (bulk shipments from/to 1P and 3P warehouses) and Amazon Shipping (parcel shipments from/to 1P and 3P warehouses).
The ASCS FP\&A and Automation Finance Manager will own the consolidation of the financials for the 8 ASCS services. This role will partner with each service’s finance team and business leaders to build a single financial narrative for our ASCS business to be presented to STeam and BOD. This role will also partner with each service finance team and with other central finance teams (such as Ops Central Finance, Product teams and IPAT) to standardize and automate the 8 ASCS P\&Ls.
This leader will also own the automation roadmap for the Externalized Fulfillment services within ASCS (Multi\-channel fulfillment/MCF and Buy with Prime/BwP) with the objective of eliminating manual inputs. This leader will be the main MCF/BwP Finance POC to the Data Analytics team and define the data and reports required by Finance from this team.
We are looking for finance leaders who are passionate about building new businesses, FP\&A and automation.
Key job responsibilities
\- ASCS financials consolidation and reporting including quarterly guidance, monthly and quarterly business reviews, Steam and BOD.
\- Delivering on ASCS standardization and automation VP level goals.
\- Develop and deliver on the automation roadmap for MCF and BWP (Externalized Fulfillment).
\- Drive revenue, cost and controls improvement initiatives across ASCS businesses.
  

* 4\+ years of identifying, leading, and executing opportunities to improve, automate, standardize or simplify finance or business tools and processes experience
* MBA, or CPA
* Knowledge of SQL/ETL
* Experience working with large\-scale data mining and reporting tools (examples: SQL, MS Access, Essbase, Cognos) and other financial systems (examples: Oracle, SAP, Lawson, JD Edwards)

title: Software Development Engineer, EC2 Seatbelt
description:
\- 3\+ years of non\-internship professional software development experience
\- 2\+ years of non\-internship design or architecture (design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and existing systems experience
\- Experience programming with at least one software programming language
  

Are you the type of person who enjoys solving complex problems in the cloud? Do you enjoy making an impact at a massive scale and keeping millions of customers' data safe in the cloud? Are you obsessed with designing software that efficiently works with large scale executions, and leveraging the technological breadth of AWS ? Do you want the adrenaline rush of protecting customers, and working with services in relation to detecting or implementing cloud protection? If this is you, then we have got an opportunity for you!
As a Software Engineer on the EC2 Seatbelt team, you will be developing new software systems and creating features for existing software systems. You will solve mission critical development and operations problems throughout the global presence for EC2\. You’d design and own robust systems with cloud scale best practices. You’d leverage deep experience of running a critical service with zero downtime, eliminating scalability bottlenecks and monitoring in every dimension.
You would enjoy working closely with a peer group of highly talented engineers, and in an environment that encourages innovation, calculated risk taking and rapid decision making.
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee\-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.
Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work\-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life\-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.
Mentorship \& Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one\-on\-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better\-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future
Key job responsibilities
As a Software Engineer on the EC2 Seatbelt team, you will be building and enhancing software systems. You will solve mission critical development and operations problems throughout the global presence for EC2\. You’d design and own robust systems with cloud scale best practices. You’d leverage deep experience of running a critical service with zero downtime, eliminating scalability bottlenecks and monitoring in every dimension. You would enjoy working closely with a peer group of highly talented engineers, and in an environment that encourages innovation, calculated risk taking and rapid decision making.
About the team
The EC2 Seatbelt team develops and maintains secure infrastructure for ad\-hoc operations in EC2 at scale, prioritizing operator safety and controlled execution. Our platform enables operators to create, manage and execute scripts for LSE mitigation and operational issues when standard methods are ineffective. While offering flexibility, Seatbelt maintains strict approval processes and leadership visibility to ensure EC2's reliability and security.
  

* 3\+ years of full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations experience
* Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent

title: Business Intel Engineer II, Amazon Grocery Logistics (AGL), Amazon Grocery Logistics (AGL)
description:
\- 3\+ years of analyzing and interpreting data with Redshift, Oracle, NoSQL etc. experience
\- Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools
\- Experience with data modeling, warehousing and building ETL pipelines
\- Experience in Statistical Analysis packages such as R, SAS and Matlab
\- Experience using SQL to pull data from a database or data warehouse and scripting experience (Python) to process data for modeling
  

Amazon Grocery is seeking a Business Intelligence Engineer (BIE) who is passionate about data. Our team, seeks to develop solutions that increase the speed and quality of decision\-making through analytics, automation and reporting. In this role, you will drive Grocery Instock \& Shrink analytics and developing insight driven tooling.
To be successful in this role, you must have a high capacity to Learn and Be Curious adapting to the latest changes in the business, systems, tools, and techniques for extracting, processing, analyzing, modeling, and taking action on data. The ideal candidate will be a self\-starter, highly analytical, consistently think in terms of automation, and intensely detailed with a strong customer focus to drive strategy in a fast\-paced environment with limited supervision. The ideal candidate shows good judgment in making technical trade\-offs between short term and long\-term business needs and demonstrate the ability to drive issues to completion.
As a BIE on our team you will focus on exciting and challenging problems, including:
Apply your deep analytic and business intelligence skill to extract meaningful insight from large and complicated data sets
Engage business stakeholders in constructive dialogues to convert business problems into logic problems that can be solved with data, statistics, and/or scripting
Design, develop, and implement scalable, automated infrastructure for data extraction, processing, computation, and delivery
Support fellow engineers and scientists to deliver analytical projects and build proof of concept applications
Work closely with data engineering, product management, and business stakeholders to deliver features to customers
Learn new technology and techniques such that you can meaningfully support product and process innovation
Help drive new initiatives and data integration projects
  

* Experience with AWS solutions such as EC2, DynamoDB, S3, and Redshift
* Experience in data mining, ETL, etc. and using databases in a business environment with large\-scale, complex datasets
